name: Percent Wetlands in Watershed
functionStatement: Wetlands and storage features store floodwater, recharge groundwater, sustain baseflow, and provide low-velocity habitat.
descriptionMarkdown: Sufficient wetlands/ponds for flood attenuation/baseflow support, unless minimal wetlands are historically normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Calculate the percent area classified as wetlands using a land cover or wetlands layer. Where possible, compute within the mapped floodplain or valley bottom to better reflect storage.

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: >5% wetland coverage, or consistent with historical norm. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: <1% wetland coverage, or heavily drained wetlands. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: NLCD Land Cover and/or USFWS National Wetlands Inventory (NWI).

bin1.name: Poor
bin1.desc: <1% wetland coverage, or heavily drained wetlands.

bin3.name: Good
bin3.desc: >5% wetland coverage, or consistent with historical norm.
